reviews.review: Great game, a little disapointed that bunny hopping was cut short and no longer available, it was something that took skill. game graphics greatly improved, alot of changes over the old CS to be sure, disapointing that knifes were no longer able to get headshots. all in all great FPS and was my addiction till CS:GO.
Jogo ótimo e muito divertido com graficos bons e bonitos que rodam em pcs um pouco fracos! Recomendo muito!
Le classique et toujours aussi bon CSS !!
A classic game to play at any time.
Что может быть лучше, чет зависнуть с друзьями в Сурсу?
muito maneiro o jogo, relembra muito os tempos de lan house

I don't remember why I got this game, I believe it was bundled with GMOD and CS:GO. At the time I did not have a good enough GPU to play CS:GO on anything other than the worst possible settings. I also had been playing pretty much exclusively TF2 for a couple of years. I wasn't really looking for new games, but GMOD is just kind of a must-have. One day I opened up CSS and played for a few hours on the NIGHTEAM Dust server (No, not dust 2). It was perfect. I was okay as far as aim went because of the extreme amount of time playing TF2, but the idea that you cannot be accurate when moveing was a new concept to me. I played mostly sniper in TF2 so the auto-sniper was my go-to for a while (I know, you can crucify me now). The NIGHTEAM servers all have bots that automatically join the game if there aren't enough players, so I was fighting mainly players with lots of time on the game and bots on the lowest difficulty. It was a good enough mix for me to feel like I was doing alright while still having a skill-level to shoot for. Something about the game hooked me. It definitely wasn't the graphics. It definitely wasn't the 4 different player-models. It wasn't the mass amounts of unbalanced maps, over and underpowered weapons, rampant hackers, or even the god-awful barrel physics. I think it was the community. I met so many people who were in their early 20's who played the game growing up the way I had been playing TF2. Some of them were quiet, rarely using the chat but with calling cards such as keybinds or a signature spray. Others were on the mic 24/7 swearing up a storm, but always in good fun. And some were just normal people with a good mix of the two. What all of them had in common was the amount of time they put in on that same map and server. When somebody new showed up, they weren't hard on them. When somebody new was a massive dick, they would be surrounded on all sides by people who would tear them apart. They never saw it coming, because they didn't know that everybody there was friends with one another. Close connections to the admins, and people who loved trash-talk in good fun, made for a very healthy server at pretty much all times. After playing as much of this game as I have, I cannot find myself playing much CS:GO without coming back to this. Something about it. Something about the game has kept itself alive. With many veteran players, new players who got the game on sale like I did, and people still hosting competitive events, it's community lives on. For now. Give it a shot!
Epic game played it over the years for hours on end :)

Css мой самый первый онлайновый шутер и если сревновать его с другими играми то,да у новых графика лучьше,но эта игра просто затягивает,например:если всё надоело и не хочешь играть зайдёх в cs и затягивает на 3-4 часа.А cs:go это... полная  хрень многим может она и нравится но она не затягивает как css и cs1.6,и по моему это самый лучьший шутер.И чуть не забыл они даже позаботили о том правша ты или левша.

-Gameplay: Um dos melhores FPS de todos se pá o melhor de todos, sem essas frescuras de hoje em dia, o  é FODA além de ser super barato comparado aos preços dos FPS (que são bons) hoje em dia... 

-História: Simples, Terroristas versus uma força Contra-Terrorista.

-Peso do game: Mais ou menos leve, nem todo PC pode rodar esse game com um bom desempenho.

Counter Strike Source is a classic FPS made by the creators of Half Life and TF2. It is a fun shooter to play with an array of weapons and gamemodes. I recomened this to any one looking to play a good shooter. I rate this game 8/10.
